intro: Trochocephalus mansenensis, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant has thick, fleshy stems and leaves that are opposite and ovate in shape. Its flowers emit a strong fragrance to attract nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant is also noted for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
